document.docAuthor: Nguyen, Thi Anh Duong & Peña-Santiago, Reyes
document.docTitle: Metaxonchium silvaticum Nguyen & Peña-Santiago 2018, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Metaxonchium Coomans & Nair, 1975 (Nematoda, Dorylaimida, Belondiridae) from Vietnam

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Metaxonchium Coomans & Nair, 1975 (Nematoda, Dorylaimida, Belondiridae) from Vietnam

subSubSection.paragraph: Material examined : TwElvE fEmAlES ANd ONE mAlE fROm CAT BA NATIONAl PARk, IN AccEPTAblE cONdITION. Morphometrics : SEE TAblE 1 .

species from Vietnam. Measurements in µm (except L, in mm), and in the form: mean ± standard deviation (range).

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Adult: MOdERATElY SlENdER NEmATOdES ( a = 26–28) Of mEdIUm SIzE bOdY 1.27–1.48 mm lONg. BOdY cYlINdRIcAl, vISIblY TAPERINg TOwARdS THE ANTERIOR ENd, lESS SO TOwARdS THE POSTERIOR ENd SINcE THE cAUdAl REgION IS SHORT ANd ROUNdEd. CUTIclE 1.0–1.5 µm THIck IN ANTERIOR REgION, 1.5–2.5 µm AT mId–bOdY ANd 6.5–8.5 µm ON dORSAl SIdE Of TAIl; IT IS TwO–lAYEREd, cONSISTINg Of OUTER lAYER dISTINcTlY THINNER THAN THE INNER ONE , wITH cONSTANT THIckNESS THROUgHOUT THE bOdY, APPARENTlY dIvIdEd IN TwO SUblAYERS, ANd bEARINg vERY fINE TRANSvERSE STRIATION, ANd THIck INNER lAYER, ESPEcIAllY ObvIOUS IN cAUdAl REgION. GUIdINg RINg THIN , SImPlE bUT vISIblY REfRAcTIvE, AT 8–9 µm OR 1.1–1.3 TImES THE lIP REgION dIAmETER fROm THE ANTERIOR ENd. OdONTOPHORE ROd–lIkE 12–13 µm, 1.3–1.6 TImES THE OdONTOSTYlE lENgTH. PHARYNX cONSISTINg Of A SlENdER ANd wEAklY mUScUlAR ANTERIOR PORTION SEPARATEd fROm THE bASAl EXPANSION bY A SHORT ISTHmUS–lIkE SEcTION, ANd A bASAl EXPANSION 12–17 TImES AS lONg AS bROAd, 7.0–9.8 TImES lONgER THAN bOdY dIAmETER AT NEck bASE, ANd OccUPYINg 65–76% Of TOTAl NEck lENgTH; A vERY dISTINcT SPIRAl mUScUlAR SHEATH, wITH NEARlY STRAIgHT mUScUlAR bANdS, ENvElOPS THE wHOlE bASAl EXPANSION. CARdIA cONOId TO cONIcAl, 16–28 X 11 –16 µm wIdE, SURROUNdEd bY INTESTINAl TISSUE.

Female : GENITAl SYSTEm mONOdElPHIc–OPISTHOdElPHIc. ANTERIOR bRANcH REdUcEd TO A SImPlE UTERINE SAc 65–80 µm lONg, 1.0–1.6 TImES THE cORRESPONdINg bOdY dIAmETER ANd OccUPYINg 4–6% Of bOdY lENgTH. ONE fEmAlE bEARINg AN OvOId UTERINE Egg, 150 X 43 µm. VUlvA A SOmEwHAT POST-EqUATOIRAl TRANSvERSE SlIT. PREREcTUm 3.0–5.0, REcTUm 1.0–1.3 ANAl bOdY dIAmETERS lONg. Male : GENITAl SYSTEm dIORcHIc, TESTES OPPOSEd. IN AddITION TO THE Ad–clOAcAl PAIR, SITUATEd AT 11 µm fROm clOAcAl APERTURE, THERE ARE SEvEN, SPAcEd (9–15 µm APART) vENTROmEdIAN SUPPlEmENTS,
THE POSTERIORmOST Of wHIcH IS SITUATEd 22 µm fROm THE AdclOAcAl PAIR , NEARlY lEvEl wITH THE SPIcUlE ANTERIOR ENd. ; vENTRAl HUmP ANd HOllOw POORlY mARkEd, THE fORmER SITUATEd AT 51% Of SPIcUlE lENgTH; cURvATURE 130°; mEdIAN PIEcE OccUPYINg TwO–fIfTHS (40%) Of mAXImUm SPIcUlE wIdTH, REAcHINg THE SPIcUlE TERmINUS. LATERAl gUIdINg PIEcE 10.5 µm lONg, 5.2 TImES lONgER THAN bROAd, wITH SOmEwHAT fURcATE TERmINUS.

Diagnosis.
Metaxonchium silvaticum
SP. N IS cHARAcTERIzEd bY ITS 1.28–1.43 mm lONg bOdY, lIP REgION OffSET bY wEAk dEPRESSION ANd 7.0 µm bROAd, OdONTOSTYlE fUSIfORm ANd 8–9 µm lONg, NEck 5 02–630 µm lONg, bOTH PARTS Of THE PHARYNX SEPARATEd bY A SHORT ISTHmUS–lIkE NARROwINg, PHARYNgEAl EXPANSION 346–470 µm lONg ANd OccUPYINg 65–76% Of TOTAl NEck lENgTH, fEmAlE gENITAl SYSTEm mONO-OPISTHOdElPHIc, ANTERIOR gENITAl bRANcH REdUcEd TO A SImPlE UTERINE SAc 65–80 µm lONg, 1.0–1.6 TImES THE cORRESPONdINg bOdY dIAmETER, POSTERIOR UTERUS TRIPARTITE (bUT NOT EcHINOPHOR) ANd 77–80 µm OR 1.5–1.6 bOdY dIAmETERS lONg, V = 52–57, TAIl SHORT ANd ROUNdEd (18–23 µm, c = 56–74, c’ = 0.6–0.8) wITH AbUNdANT blISTER–lIkE OR SAccATE bOdIES, SPIcUlES 41 µm lONg, ANd SEvEN SPAcEd vENTROmEdIAN SUPPlEmENTS.

bY ITS SmAllER gENERAl SIzE (bOdY lENgTH 1.28–1.43 vs 1.75–1.98 mm ), wEAklY ( vs dISTINcTlY) OffSET lIP REgION, ANTERIOR UTERINE SAc wITHOUT ( vs wITH) A PROXImAl cONSTRIcTION, SHORTER (18–25 vs 30–33 µm, c’ = 0.6–0.8 vs c’ = 1.0–1.2) ANd mORE ROUNdEd ( vs cONOId TO cONIcAl wITH ROUNdEd TIP) TAIl wITH ( vs wITHOUT) SAccATE bOdIES, ANd fEwER (7 vs 13–15) SPAcEd ( vs cONTIgUOUS) mAlE vENTROmEdIAN SUPPlEmENTS.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5.
Metaxonchium silvaticum
sp. n.
(Female). A: Female, entire. B: Anterior region in lateral median vieW. C: Pharyngo–intestinal junction. D: Vagina. E: Male, entire. F–H: Female, caudal region. I: Female, genital system, J: Female: posterior body region. K: Male, caudal region. L: Spicule and lateral guiding piece. (Scale bars: A, E = 200 µm; B, D = 5 µm; C, F–H, K, L = 10 µm; I = 50 µm; J = 20 µm.)

FIGURE 6.
Metaxonchium silvaticum
sp. n.
(Female, LM). A: Female, entire. B: Anterior region in lateral median view. C: Pharyngo–intestinal junction. D: Uterus. E: Male, entire. F: Vagina. G, Q: Spicule. H: Sperm cells. I, J, L, M, N: Female, caudal region. K: Female, posterior body region. O, P: Male, caudal region and spicule. (Scale bars: A, E = 200 µm; B, F, H = 5 µm; C, G, I, J, L–Q = 10 µm; D, K = 20 µm.)

subSubSection.paragraph:

FEmAlE HOlOTYPE , fIvE fEmAlE ANd ONE mAlE PARATYPES dEPOSITEd wITH THE NEmATOdE cOllEcTION Of THE UNIvERSITY Of JAéN, SPAIN . SIX fEmAlE PARATYPES dEPOSITEd wITH THE NEmATOdE cOllEcTION Of THE INSTITUTE Of EcOlOgY ANd BIOlOgIcAl RESOURcES ( IEBR ),
HANOI
, VIETNAm .
Etymology : THE SPEcIfIc EPITHET IS A LATIN TERm THAT mEANS bElONgINg TO THE fOREST ANd REfERS TO THE HAbITAT, A TROPIcAl fOREST, wHERE THE SPEcIES wAS cOllEcTEd.
